column4: Anyone know how to change the permissions on a drive so that the user and not root has permissions on the drive?
Root will always have rights -- can't take them away.  But you can add other users.
System| Admin| Users & Groups>  Choose the user in question, User privilege tab, add relevant rights.
another alternative is to modify your mount options when you mount the ntfs permissions.
Which option am I changing under user privelages?
upon reflection, I think my latter suggestion is what will help you.  Mount the NTFS filesystem with options uid=<your user>,gid=<your user's group>.
its not longer a ntfs i formatted it with gparted to a primary partition.
filesystem type and partition type are two different matters.
You may have changed the partition type and it would still be an NTFS filesystem.  But if you reformatted it as another filesystem type, then you've lost that previous data.
